job_description:
About the job
Job Description

About the Team

The Merchant Analytics Team at Wolt managed by Ayush focuses on solving merchant related challenges and is tasked with unlocking insights related to the marketplace and turn them into actionable recommendations which drive the success of merchants at Wolt.

Data Scientists at Wolt work to uncover insights and turn them into relevant recommendations, driving decisions for the entire organization. On the Merchant team we are focused on ramping up the merchant selection and finding opportunities to help merchants grow their business and be successful on Wolt. While keeping merchants at heart, the analytics team focuses on all kinds of analytics projects which can benefit merchants while ensuring a seamless consumer experience and also supporting Wolt‚Äôs marketplace strategy.

Our team comprises a cross-section of Data Scientists and BI Developers. We work closely with the Data Engineering and Machine Learning teams who help ensure we have the right platform to deliver our insights at scale. We partner with Product, Engineering, and Strategy & Operations teams to guide measurement and tactical decision-making using advanced analytics as we expand the Wolt platform across the globe.



As a Data Scientist at Wolt, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision making. This is a rare, operational and actionable data-driven experience. When you join this team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, rather than just doing yet another analytics role.

If you enjoy finding patterns amidst chaos, are excited to build from 0 to 1, and have experience using analytics to affect marketplace growth, we're looking for someone like you.



















The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realise you really, really want to join us!

If you want to check up on your application or have any further questions about the position you can turn to Group Talent Acquisition Partner / Analytics, Michal Szafraniec at michal.szafraniec@wolt.com



Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app ‚Äì we‚Äôre a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry‚Äôs highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt‚Äôs name, brand, product, technology and team.



We want to have all sorts of people in our team ‚Äì people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates ‚Äì when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait ‚Äì we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you‚Äôll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Michal Szafraniec

job_title: Analytics Lead - Business Intelligence, Wolt Market BI
required_skills: Analytics and Data AnalyticsBusiness Insights, Commerce, Communication, Leadership, Presentation Skills, Presentations, Quantification, and Representational State Transfer (REST)
location: Wolt ¬∑ Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  1 week ago  ¬∑ Over 50 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Job Description

We're looking for awesome people to join Wolt as a Business Intelligence Lead role in Helsinki, Stockholm or Berlin. We have Data Analysts and Business Intelligence Developers working as embedded data professionals in different business domains and now we‚Äôre looking to grow to the next level of maturity and establish proper analytics teams in these domains.

For an analytics leader, Wolt‚Äôs fast-moving business as a local three-sided marketplace offers a demanding but rewarding environment to grow one‚Äôs skills in modern analytics. You get to learn a lot, lead a team, grow a team, drive impact via analytics and work with the best people. What could be better than that?



You wonder whatis? It is a chain of dark grocery stores available on Wolt‚Äôs well known delivery platform.delivers groceries to our users within 30 minutes. Last year we took a leap forward with a dedicated product offering for Wolt Market - Retail Platforms. We successfully built from scratch several teams of talented Engineers, Product Leads and Designers building internal tooling within the areas like warehousing, assortment, catalog and pricing. In this domain, you‚Äôll have exposure to end-to-end processes of running a quick commerce business, from supply chain optimization to improving consumer experience.







What we hope from you is that you first and foremost identify yourself as an analytics enthusiast. No matter what the subject of analysis is, you want to deeply understand the problem statement, mechanics of the business and data generation processes as well as impact via analytics. Coming up with ways to measure incremental business impact of the changes in our platform and operations is the key theme for Analytics at Wolt, and this role is instrumental in quantification of the changes. You will lead a team of Business Intelligence Developers who deeply care about designing and implementing scalable analytics solutions to various teams in the Wolt Market domain.



Our stakeholders turn to Analytics for objective and reliable measurements and insights. Success in your domain area means that you together with your team members a) establish a solid and scalable reporting framework with your Product and Data stakeholders, b) provide Operations stakeholders with reliable tracking of the business metrics (that you help to design) and c) guide the design and implementation of automation needed for enabling the stakeholders as well as Analytics team members. Experience in the domain area is essential as we want to see a leader who‚Äôs not only passionate about analytics in general but also applying it in a certain domain.



We are looking for a lead who would split their time 50/50 between hands-on work and team leadership. While the role will be more hands-on initially, time used for team leadership may increase as the team grows. In general here at Wolt we value doers so even in senior leadership roles we value that if need be you can do the hands-on work.



We are primarily looking for people with experience in analytics leadership roles as we foresee that BI team in Wolt Market Analytics will continue growing. Hence we‚Äôre looking for people who know how to scale analytics organizations. At the same time, we are willing to consider candidates without prior experience in team leadership but who have a strong desire to grow to that role.



You‚Äôll also need to be the representative of your function towards the rest of the organization, so strong communication and presentation skills are needed. As analytics is a team effort you have to be a cultural leader that cares for the wellbeing and constant improvement of your team members.









The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realise you really, really want to join us!

If you want to check up on your application or have any further questions about the position you can turn to Group Talent Acquisition Partner / Analytics, Michal Szafraniec at michal.szafraniec@wolt.com

job_description:
About the job
Open source is our beating heart and it‚Äôs something that fuels our work and our culture. It‚Äôs where we began. It‚Äôs where we‚Äôll always be. Our vision is to become the trusted open source data platform for everyone. We are a Cast of over 400 individuals (‚ÄòCrabs‚Äô) located across the globe. Why Crabs? Because we believe in thinking sideways. And right now, we‚Äôre looking for sideways-thinking engineers.

The Engineering team at Aiven lies at the core of our organization. This is a great opportunity to become an integral member of the team as a Staff Software Engineer. We look for engineers who can work around problems by finding new angles. Thinking sideways. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with world-class tech people solving the toughest problems, where almost every project you work on is more complex and technically challenging than the previous one. If you relish pushing your technical boundaries, come join us. Because if you can truly think sideways, you‚Äôll never look back.



So, how do we become the trusted open source data platform for everyone? By listening closely to our customers and taking action to ensure they achieve their business goals. You see, the software we create is merely a means of delivering value. Our thinking is customer-first. That‚Äôs why our customers are at the front and center of all we do. And in the spirit of sideways thinking, we‚Äôre by their side as well. Actively helping them solve their challenges. Collaborating. Sharing. And innovating. In other words, it really isn‚Äôt just about who we are. It‚Äôs about who our customers are ‚Äì and where they want to be.



We want individuals who can embody our values of ownership, courage, and openness.

What does that mean in practice?

We take ownership of the problems we solve. What we do is about improving life for our customers, enabling them to meet their goals. So we own our decisions and mistakes. Sometimes that takes courage. But we don‚Äôt falter ‚Äì we take on challenges with confidence. And right at our heart is openness. We‚Äôre always open to new ideas ‚Äì from wherever and whoever they come.

The Role:

We are looking for an experienced backend software engineer to work on our cloud operations platform turning the best open source technologies into frustration-free cloud services. You‚Äôll be part of a team working on the Aiven cloud platform, improving its scalability and reliability, implementing new features as well as extending our product portfolio of open source data technologies



What You'll Do:





What We're Looking For:

Don‚Äôt worry if your experience doesn‚Äôt line up perfectly ‚Äì we still encourage you to apply! We believe in investing in our crabs‚Äô professional growth.









Our Offer

If you ask us what‚Äôs the best thing about working for Aiven, many will probably say it‚Äôs the high concentration of talent from around the world that we have here. Enjoy the agile environment of a hyperscale scale-up where you can truly make an impact and have fun while at it.

We invest in you



Make a difference at Aiven



What else

As well as the above Global Benefits, we have regional benefits specific to your country of residence. We would be happy to discuss these further with you during the interview process

Amazing, What‚Äôs next

If you think Aiven is the place for you, send us your CV, and we‚Äôll get in touch!

job_description:
About the job
Location: Vantaa, Finland

Thales people architect identity management and data protection solutions at the heart of digital security. Business and governments rely on us to bring trust to the billons of digital interactions they have with people. Our technologies and services help banks exchange funds, people cross borders, energy become smarter and much more. More than 30,000 organizations already rely on us to verify the identities of people and things, grant access to digital services, analyze vast quantities of information and encrypt data to make the connected world more secure.

As a market leader within Digital Identity & Security, Thales makes personal digital interactions simple and secure in an increasingly connected society. From secure software to biometrics and encryption, Thales provides technologies and services that enables business and governments to authenticate identities and protect data, enabling clients to offer trusted digital services to billions of individuals. Located in Vantaa since 2010, the site is specialized in development and manufacturing within Identity & Biometric solutions as well as Banking & Payment. Working commercially across all business areas within Digital Identity & Security, Thales has become a trusted partner within various businesses as well as governments throughout the Nordics.









A great opportunity has opened for an experienced project manager to join ourYou will be joining a team of motivated professionals and work in close cooperation with our sales and production teams. On top of that, you will have colleagues all over the world that are excited to welcome you at Thales.

As a, you have two main missions:


You will play a pivotal role throughout the full customer lifecycle, leading the technical offer writing in tenders, managing delivery projects during the implementation phase, and cultivate long-lasting relationships with customers during the contract delivery. You will enjoy strong organizational support from the product and operational teams of market leading company.

In addition to the technical scope of your work you will also be involved into the commercial dialogues supporting Sales and Service Delivery teams.

You will report to Document Regional Leader.












We at Thales offer you a supporting work environment. We value work-life balance and we offer great opportunities for internal mobility. Many of our employees have a long history with the company and we offer a host of different benefits to our employees. To name a few:


At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

job_description:
About the job
About Agoda 

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.



Location: Bangkok, Thailand (*Not open for remote work.)



Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.



Agoda first started selling air tickets in late 2019; we are currently looking to grow the commercial team in North Asia to help grow our young Flights business into a market leader in APAC.

As part of the Flights Team, you will be responsible for identifying new partners and opportunities, cultivating a relationship with them, and working together with them to deliver the best outcome for our end customers. You would also be responsible with managing the day to day interaction with the partner and working closely with other teams within Agoda to ensure the partners needs are met.

We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda‚Äôs unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we build new channels to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.



As an Analyst/Senior Analyst, you will report directly to either the Senior Manager or Associate Director within the Supply Department and this will be an individual contributor role. You will be responsible and fully empowered to work with the partners on the ground. You will be supported by a team within the Supply department and work closely with other Flight Commercial Team members within Agoda.

You will have the opportunity to be part of an exciting and brand new team and new business vertical for Agoda and have the rare opportunity of joining a ‚Äòstart-up‚Äô within an established company.

:



:









At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person‚Äôs merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

Specifically, Unity‚Äôs platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.

location: Wolt ¬∑ Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  3 days ago  ¬∑ 15 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Job Description

Data Scientists at Wolt build and deploy models to address business problems. Utilizing a spectrum of methodologies including statistical analysis, machine learning, and deep learning, they enhance critical processes within Wolt's online delivery platform and business operations. Their contributions significantly impact all 25 countries in which we operate.

The work consists of owninguse cases as part of a product or business team; starting from identifying opportunities, to developing and prototyping a solution, all the way to deploying, maintaining, and improving a production-ready solution inside of the embedded product team. We use a variety of technologies and tools including, SQL, Spark, Docker and K8s, Snowflake, Looker, Airflow, and Kafka to get the job done, and we have an internally developed machine learning platform (key components being Flyte, MLflow and Selcon Core), at our data scientists‚Äô disposal. We are constantly looking for ways to improve how our data scientists work.

We are looking for a Data Scientist to be embedded into ourMerchant Catalog team, to work together with engineers, product, design and analytics people, on developing algorithms and solutions for improving our understanding of the different items, whether they are food or retail, that we sell. An example of this is creating product hierarchies and categorizations from item descriptions and images. The team owns the domain end to end, from developing approaches, to testing, and to understanding their impact and deploying and maintaining them.

Also, to learn more about Wolt, be sure to check out Machine learning at Wolt - our journey towards MLOps, our Wolt Algorithmic Transparency Report, and Wolt Tech Talks. üí°

About the job
The application process for OP Group's 2024 Kiitorata Trainee Program is now underway! We are looking for open-minded and courageous talents to join us in diverse and challenging roles across various business areas.

Join Our Team People and Culture Trainee in Helsinki



As a People and Culture Trainee, you will have the unique opportunity to experience the inner workings of HR at Finland's largest financial institution. During your trainee period, you will actively contribute to business-focused HR practices, working in collaboration with HR Business Partners and specialist teams. Your responsibilities will encompass workforce planning, employee well-being, diversity, and competency development. Our HR strategy, which revolves around having a skilled, motivated, and thriving workforce, will also guide your journey as a People and Culture Trainee.



We are looking for individuals who have a genuine interest in people, organisations and human resources work. You should be comfortable with data analysis, have strong communication skills and possess a solution focused mindset. You are someone who wants to help grow the well-being of both individuals and the organization, helping OP and its people succeed together in its mission to help its customers prosper.

Your educational background may include fields such as business or administrative sciences, organizational psychology, HR, or educational sciences, or other areas that support the development of a future HR professional.

Fluency in English is essential, and proficiency in Finnish is highly advantageous for this role.



The People and Culture function within the OP Group drives all activities that contribute to the success of individuals and organizations - with a human-centered and inclusive approach. We partner with the business in both strategic and daily business matters and offer a wide range of services aimed at growing skills & capabilities, leadership, and well-being. Our goal is to enable the success of our business segments as well as the OP Group as a whole. Our People & Culture team is made of diverse experts working in different fields of HR as a single, highly functional team .



As a People and Culture Trainee, you will have a firsthand experience of HR operations in Finlands largest financial institution. You will engage in challenging pieces of work, gaining a wealth of professional skills and knowledge as you go along. Your dedication and positive attitude can influence your career path with us, and we are committed to supporting your development and encouraging you to grow. You will be employed by OP with a paid six-month contract from March 1 to August 31, 2024, with the same monthly salary of ‚Ç¨3000 offered to all trainees.

In addition to responsible work, we prioritize your well-being and offer forward-looking work arrangements. We provide a stable environment where values such as responsibility, human-centeredness, and shared success are at the core.

You'll have access to a wide range of employee benefits, including banking, insurance, and loan services. We also provide comprehensive occupational health care and full-time accident insurance. To support your work-life balance, we offer lunch, sports, and cultural benefits, as well as the opportunity for affordable vacations at OP's holiday resorts.







If you have any questions about the position or working with us, Tommi Korhonen, Johtaja, at 010 252 1995 Friday October 10 from 10 to 11 am and Wednesday November 1 from 10 to 11 am.

Next, we'd like to learn more about you. Apply by sharing your qualifications and motivation with us no later than November 5, 2023, by clicking the "Apply Now" button. We will start reviewing applications as soon as the application period opens, so explore our diverse trainee roles and send your application to us today!

In the financial sector, trust and responsibility are the cornerstones of our operations. Therefore, the selected candidate will undergo a credit check, background check, and a drug test.

OP Group is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion. We encourage individuals of all backgrounds, gender identities, ages, and cultural or minority groups to apply.

The Data Center team designs and operates some of the most sophisticated electrical engineering, mechanical engineering and HVAC systems in the world. Facilities Technicians at Google data centers operate, monitor and support physical facilities conditions. Some of these duties will include heating and cooling of air and water, power supply, generators, UPS systems, electrical distribution and control and monitoring systems. You regularly help inspect, maintain and repair various data center systems such as piping and non-critical electrical or mechanical system components). You provide daily assistance to senior technicians as you read blueprints/schematics, conduct tours of systems and assess their working order.

As an advocate for best practices, you develop creative approaches to reducing operational costs while improving overall data center efficiency. You ensure that environmental and safety standards are consistently met, identifying problems and making repairs quickly. In emergency situations or abnormal conditions, you manage data center performance issues and outages to minimize the recovery time from failures.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

About the job
Who We Are
Mapbox is the leading real-time location platform for a new generation of location-aware businesses. Mapbox is the only platform that equips organizations with the full set of tools to power the navigation of people, packages, and vehicles everywhere. More than 3.9 million registered developers have chosen Mapbox because of the platform‚Äôs flexibility, security, and privacy compliance. Organizations use Mapbox applications, data, SDKs, and APIs to create customized and immersive experiences that delight their customers.

Navigation serves customers with use cases ranging from turn-by-turn navigation in electric vehicles to delivery route planning for fleets of thousands of trucks. Our services are often at the heart of our customers' businesses, be it BMW, Porsche, Toyota, Rivian, General Motors, DPD, Instacart, The Weather Channel, Strava or in total more than two million developers worldwide serving over 600 million users monthly. We provide powerful routing engines, accurate, traffic-powered travel times, and intuitive turn-by-turn directions to help our customers build engaging navigation experiences.
The Navigation team develops and operates web services powering virtually all of Mapbox‚Äôs strategic navigation products in consumer, automotive, and logistics. This is a highly multidisciplinary team, with work spanning distributed systems on AWS to geospatial localization, traffic telemetry, operations research, data science, and mapping.




As a Senior C++ Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and operating significant areas of our routing services. In this role, you can expect to:

Logistics API services interact with many internal systems at Mapbox, making this a high-visibility team with great opportunities to collaborate across the company.

location: Supercell ¬∑ Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  1 week ago  ¬∑ Over 50 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We are looking for a dedicated and skilled Product Support Manager to help guide our teams in providing exceptional support to players within our games. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of gamers‚Äô behaviour, as well as the ability to leverage data and insights to drive product-specific changes.

Responsibilities:











Luring you in with glitter, glamour, and gems is not what we seek to do. We develop Supercell as an employer for you to do your best work and to call this the best experience in your professional life. We want you to fully enjoy your time here, so we structure our compensation and benefits to serve this purpose. We start with perceiving you as a human being, not a resource.



We are a game company based in Helsinki, Finland, with offices in San Francisco, Seoul and Shanghai. Since our launch in 2010, we've released five games globally ‚Äì Hay Day, Clash of Clans, Boom Beach, Clash Royale and Brawl Stars.

To make five games, we've killed dozens along the way. That's because we're obsessed with quality. Our goal is to make the best games ‚Äì games that are played by millions, enjoyed for years and remembered forever. To achieve this goal, we create the best possible teams and give them the freedom and independence that are core to our success.



If you love to think, talk, play and make games, Supercell is the place for you. We're made up of proactive, independent teams with the freedom to do what they think is best for their players, our games and the company at large. We know that it takes more than just independence to make great games, so we also take very good care of our people ‚Äì providing them with the compensation, work environment and resources they need to succeed.



Luckily, moving to Helsinki is easier than you might think. No matter where you would be moving from, our dedicated people will help you from beginning to end. We're here to make sure the process is as smooth as possible for you, your family and whoever and whatever you're bringing along.

About Agoda 

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.



As part of the Supply Analytics Team, you will be responsible for identifying new partners and opportunities, cultivating a relationship with them, and working together with them to deliver the best outcome for our end customers. You would also be responsible with managing the day to day interaction with the partner and working closely with other teams within Agoda to ensure the partners needs are met.

We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda‚Äôs unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we build new channels to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.



As an Analyst/Senior Analyst, you will report directly to either the Senior Manager or Associate Director within the Supply Department and this will be an individual contributor role. You will be responsible and fully empowered to work with the partners on the ground. You will be supported by a team within the Supply department and work closely with other Team members within Agoda.

. You will deep-dive into the environmental legislation of different regions and create processes to efficiently share this knowledge within the company. You will also anticipate which direction the rules are heading in the future, so we can stay ahead.

job_description:
About the job
Job Description

AWS Solution Architect, Espoo (Finland)

Hansen Technologies is implementing a multi-tenant, cloud native, Meter Data Management (MDM-) and Energy Data Management (EDM-) system which is offered to our customers within the energy sector in a cloud service model of.

Our solution plays a vital role in ensuring that collected energy meter data is accurately stored and or repaired in a timely manner. Curated data is then used within a wide range of downstream processes. Our solution is a critical link in making sure that grid operators and energy retail companies have the necessary information to manage their energy infrastructure and comply to the legislative responsibilities within the energy market (now with a primary focus on Finland).

We are looking for an AWS Solution Architect to join our DevOpsteam. Team has a combination of energy domain experts and AWS cloud development competences and functions in a hybrid way of working. Microservices, serverless, containers are some of the most common used technologies within our cloud native approach.













What we offer to you is professionally challenging opportunities in a dynamic industry with excellent career opportunities in a growing global company. The Hansen way of crafting the experience is characterized by a sense of humor, commitment and ownership. We‚Äôll introduce you to a team of highly skilled colleagues from whom you can learn both locally and globally.

You might also appreciate some of the perks and benefits we have in store for you ‚Äì flexibility to organize your work, professional training and development plus a wide range of other fringe benefits.

If we‚Äôve sparked your interest, please press the apply button and let‚Äôs get to know each other! We are interviewing candidates on an ongoing basis and hope to hear from you soon! Should you have any questions, please don‚Äôt hesitate to contact Lead Talent Acquisition Partner Kasper Kuusela ( Kasper.kuusela@hansencx.com ) for more information about us or the position.

location: Wolt ¬∑ Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  6 days ago  ¬∑ 33 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Job Description

About the Consumer Group

As the name Consumer Group implies, this group is responsible for building and developing Wolt‚Äôs consumer-facing products. The core mission is to master the user experience while scaling up the platform to enable delivering a mall in a pocket.

Inside the Consumer Group, there are several teams, and two of them are currently in need of more Data Analyst support - Pricing and AdTech. This advert is focused on the Pricing domain, but if you‚Äôre interested in AdTech, please check this job advert.


The Consumer Pricing Data Science team is committed to consumer-first pricing that's fair, transparent, and compliant. We create innovative pricing solutions that offer clear value for our consumers. We collaborate cross-functionally to achieve both short-term and long-term business goals. Our team of Data Scientists and partners closely with Product, Engineering, Strategy & Operations, conducting experiments, advanced analytics, and operational reporting to enhance our consumer pricing strategies.


Our Consumer Analytics team comprises a cross-section of Data Scientists and Analytics Engineers. We work closely with the Data Engineering and Machine Learning teams who help ensure we have the right platform to deliver our insights at scale. We partner with Product, Engineering, and Strategy & Operations teams to guide measurement and tactical decision-making using advanced analytics as we expand the Wolt platform across the globe.


As a Data Scientist at Wolt, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision making. This is a rare, operational and actionable data-driven experience. When you join this team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, rather than just doing yet another analytics role.

If you enjoy finding patterns amidst chaos, are excited to build from 0 to 1, and have experience using analytics to affect Pricing, we're looking for someone like you.






The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you‚Äôll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)


Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app ‚Äì we‚Äôre a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry‚Äôs highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt‚Äôs name, brand, product, technology and team.


At Wolt, we‚Äôre about getting things done. You‚Äôll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we‚Äôre the very core of Wolt‚Äôs products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.


We want to have all sorts of people in our team ‚Äì people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates ‚Äì when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait ‚Äì we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

location: Wolt ¬∑ Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  2 weeks ago  ¬∑ 23 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Job Description

We're looking for awesome people to join Wolt as an Analytics Lead for our Finance and Fintech domain in Helsinki or Berlin. We have Data Analysts and Business Intelligence Developers working as embedded data professionals in different business domains and now we‚Äôre looking to grow to the next level of maturity and establish proper analytics teams in these domains.

For an analytics leader Wolt‚Äôs fast-moving business as a local three-sided marketplace offers a demanding but rewarding environment to grow one‚Äôs skills in modern analytics. You get to learn a lot, lead a team, grow a team, drive impact via analytics and work with the best people. What could be better than that?



is our newly built team that will become a home for all the financial and fintech products reporting and analysis. You‚Äôll have a chance to join the team at its early stages and have a visible impact on the processes and decisions. The team will be working hand in hand with the FP&A organization and the payment and fintech product teams.





What we hope from you is that you first and foremost identify yourself as an analytics enthusiast. No matter what the subject of analysis is, you want to deeply understand the problem statement, mechanics of the business and data generation processes as well as deliver insights and impact via analytics. Coming up with ways to measure incremental business impact of the changes in our platform and operations is the key theme for everyone working in analytics at Wolt.



Our stakeholders turn to Analytics for objective and reliable measurements and insights. Success in your domain area means that you together with your team members a) establish a solid ground and structure around the financial reporting with exceptional care on the data reliability and correctness b) provide Top management stakeholders with reliable tracking of the business metrics (that you help to design) and c) provide all stakeholders with data-informed guidance and recommendations on things to improve and work on. Experience in the domain area is essential as we want to see a leader who‚Äôs not only passionate about analytics in general but also applying it in a certain domain.



We are looking for both team leads, who would split their time 50/50 between hands-on work and team leadership, and more senior leaders who most likely have 0-20 % of time to allocate to hands-on work. In general here at Wolt we value doers so even in senior leadership roles we value that if need be you can do the hands-on work.



We are primarily looking for people with experience in analytics leadership roles as we foresee that many of the domain specific analytics teams will grow to be teams with subteams. This is especially true for domains where we don‚Äôt have any leads at the moment. In those domains we‚Äôre looking for people who know how to scale analytics organisations. However we do also have team leadership roles in areas like marketing, advertising and content discovery where we are willing to consider candidates without prior experience in team leadership but who have a strong desire to grow to that role.



You‚Äôll also need to be the representative of your function towards the rest of the organisation, so strong communication and presentation skills are needed. As analytics is a team effort you have to be a cultural leader that cares for the wellbeing and constant improvement of your team members.









The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realise you really, really want to join us!

If you want to check up on your application or have any further questions about the position you can turn to Group Talent Acquisition Partner / Analytics, Michal Szafraniec at michal.szafraniec@wolt.com

job_description:
About the job
Job Description

Data Scientists at Wolt are working with machine learning for the most important processes and parts of Wolt‚Äôs online delivery platform and business operations that affect all the 24 countries we operate in. The work consists of owning machine learning use cases as part of a product or business team; starting from identifying opportunities, to developing and prototyping a solution, all the way to deploying, maintaining, and improving a production-ready solution inside of the embedded product team. We use a variety of technologies and tools including Python, SQL, Spark, Docker and K8s, Snowflake, Looker, Flyte, Seldon Core, Airflow, MLflow and Kafka to get the job done, and constantly looking for ways to improve how our data scientists work. üí™üí™

We are looking for a data scientist to be embedded into our cross-functional, working together with engineers, product and analytics people, focusing on improving our pricing algorithms. The team is responsible for helpingearn customer trust through attractive prices & discounts, especially on key value items that impact price perception disproportionately. Examples of the projects that we are excited about and would love to see you contribute towards include improving our pricing algorithms with machine learning, improving our experimentation platform for pricing, and markdown optimisation.

You wonder whatis? It is a chain of dark grocery stores available on Wolt‚Äôs well known delivery platform. Wolt Market delivers groceries to our users within 30 minutes. Last year we took a leap forward with a dedicated product offering for Wolt Market - Retail Platforms. We successfully built from scratch several teams of talented Engineers, Product Leads and Designers building internal tooling within the areas like warehousing, assortment, catalog and pricing.

Also, to learn more about Wolt, be sure to check out Machine learning at Wolt - our journey towards MLOps, our Wolt Algorithmic Transparency Report, and Wolt Tech Talks. üí°

















The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

job_title: Data Science Manager (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
required_skills: Data Science, User Experience (UX), and User Interface DesignBusiness Insights, Cluster Analysis, Cost Engineering, Market Analysis, Neural Networks, Predictive Modeling, and Quantitative Data
location: Agoda ¬∑ Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  1 week ago  ¬∑ 10 applicants
job_description:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.


The Data department oversees all of Agoda‚Äôs data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company‚Äôs culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.


We think of Data Science in Agoda differently. For us, a data scientist is a fusion of core production skills with analytic and business skills. We‚Äôve brought top talents from (literally) all over the world who focus relentlessly on building products which utilize ML and AI as their main edge. We know that when you infuse ML and technology, you move from good to great and that is our mission. Our Data Science managers are action driven leaders that can form vivid vision and successfully direct their people to execute it while being strongly rooted in the details and practice.

As a Data Science Manager, you will:

You are a developer of people. You love leading diverse teams of professionals with both qualitative and quantitative backgrounds using data-driven and insights-led approaches to respond quickly in a dynamic, competitive, and fast changing industry.

Tackle complex problems in the online travel and ecommerce space using a range of ML and data analysis methods. Use our huge data repositories to push our business metrics to their bounds, directly and indirectly. Foster a culture that constantly raises the bar for us and others and supports the freedom to explore and innovate.

Can we detect causation between metrics and bookings? How can automatically answer our users‚Äô questions? How do we tune our AB testing platform to ensure we aren‚Äôt optimizing noise? How do we measure experiment success to properly trade off type I and II errors? What is the ideal caching strategy for prices and how do build an ML model to implement it? How can you detect anomalies within more than one million time-series that we track daily? Can you separate between bots and human traffic? Can you make our across-data-centers replication into smart replication using ML models? These are just a few of the diverse questions we tackle and some which you will lead your team to crack. You will be impacting every aspect of the business and it will require various techniques, from diving deep into data with SQL and Big Data tools, all the way to deploying modern machine learning models.

. Work directly with the heads of the business departments and the product management team. Influence them with compelling product ideas based on data insights that can move the dial on our business.





We welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available for eligible candidates.

job_title: Senior Server Engineer, Hay Day or Brawl Stars
required_skills: Databases, Linux, and Shell ScriptingApplication Servers, Concurrent Programming, Data Architecture, Distributed Systems, Java, Scripting, and Server Side
location: Supercell ¬∑ Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  2 weeks ago  ¬∑ 31 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We are now looking for experienced Senior Server Engineers to join either the Hay Day or Brawl Stars team. As a Server Engineer at Supercell, you are an integral member of a game team, working closely with other game developers and focusing on making sure that our hundreds of millions of monthly players get the best, most uninterrupted experience possible. Depending on the game and your own interests, you can focus more on the general game server infrastructure or new game feature development ‚Äì and sometimes you do both.

Communication between server engineers in different game teams is absolutely vital to our success. Our server engineers frequently share learnings, both successes and failures, across game teams to make each team better. You must be humble, pragmatic and willing to admit and explain your mistakes. That way, the next time something goes wrong, we'll all be better prepared.

If you have experience in developing live systems and using virtualized computing, and you understand what it means to support a system with large user volumes, you might just be the person we're looking for!








Luring you in with glitter, glamour, and gems is not what we seek to do. We develop Supercell as an employer for you to do your best work and to call this the best experience in your professional life.

We want you to enjoy your time here fully, so we structure our compensation and benefits to serve this purpose. It starts with perceiving you as a human being, not a resource.


We are a game company based in Helsinki, Finland, with offices in San Francisco, Seoul and Shanghai. Since our launch in 2010, we've released five games globally ‚Äì Hay Day, Clash of Clans, Boom Beach, Clash Royale and Brawl Stars.

To make five games, we've killed dozens along the way. That's because we're obsessed with quality. Our goal is to make the best games ‚Äì played by millions, enjoyed for years and remembered forever. To achieve this goal, we create the best possible teams and give them the freedom and independence that are core to our success.


If you love to think, talk, play and make games, Supercell is the place for you. We're made up of proactive, independent teams with the freedom to do what they think is best for their players, our games and the company.

We know it takes more than independence to make great games, so we also take good care of our people, providing them with the compensation, work environment and resources they need to succeed.


Luckily, moving to Helsinki is easier than you might think. No matter where you would be moving from, our dedicated people will help you from beginning to end. We're here to make sure the process is as smooth as possible for you, your family and whoever and whatever you're bringing along.

location: Wolt ¬∑ Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  1 week ago  ¬∑ 12 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Job Description

We are looking for an Engineering Team Lead to join our Marketing Tech Engagement team. This team helps our operational marketing teams as well as other teams at Wolt succeed with platform services and data pipelines. The team had its inception with marketing as its scope, and they are still the most important stakeholder. However many other teams in the company use our services daily. We strive to make our stakeholders‚Äô lives easier and our whole marketing machine more effective by taking great care of the design of the systems and user experience of the tooling.

The team is highly technical due to the platform nature of the services we build and maintain. Some example projects that you can get excited about working on are: Audience builder platform for targeting our users with offers, communication and different app behavior. Consents platform for handling and storing data about consents in a compliant and secure manner used by all of Wolt.

The team consists of 3 Backend Engineers and more disciplines such as Data Engineering will likely be introduced. There is an emerging Go community at Wolt and our team has been pioneering its use. On the backend we use Echo (Go) and Python (FastAPI). Our APIs are documented with OpenAPI or gRPC. Spark (Scala) and SQL are used for our data engineering. Our event engine is built with Kafka, Protobuf and Benthos (Go).

As a Team Lead you'll be an inspirer, facilitator, and an enabler for the team to do what they do best, by running the development cycles of the team, help design the technical solutions, hosting regular 1on1s, and taking part in recruitment. In addition, you‚Äôll get opportunities to work alongside our colleagues at DoorDash.

Feel free to check our Wolt Tech Talks here.

This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm, or you can work remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. Read more about our remote setup here. üåç



We are not looking for any specific technologies in your toolkit. However, we expect a deep understanding of software architectures, integrations, a generalist attitude towards learning more and deep interest in all things engineering, and the ability to coach team members. A background in marketing is not required, but product development background is an asset as you‚Äôll be driving the development of top-quality software produced by the team and also communicating effectively with the Wolt teams at large.

Communicator & collaborator: We work closely with our teammates but also with business and multiple other engineering teams at Wolt so ability to build relationships also outside of your own team is crucial. We understand that everyone has their own unique way of communicating with others.

Servant leader: You already have some years of experience in leading software engineers, and have a coaching attitude. You have ideas and suggestions on how to improve the ways of working of a team and let them shine by striving for continuous improvement.



The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions ‚Äì as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt‚Äôs products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt‚Äôs mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.

job_description:
About the job
Orkla Care Finland provides Finnish homes with high-quality products for personal wellbeing, health and wound care, for home care and cleaning, as well as basic garments and underwear that fit the Finnish taste. Sustainability is part of everything we do and we want to make sustainable choices easier. This is why we continually develop products, where we take the environment into account both in production and use. Our most well-known brands are M√∂ller, Nutrilett, Sana-Sol, Jordan, L300, Salvequick, Norlyn, Pierre Robert and Black Horse. In 2021, our turnover amounted to 60 million euros and we had 79 employees.

Are you looking for a new challenge in finance to further develop your skills as a BI & Sales Controller? We are waiting for your application to join our experienced and energetic Finance team in Vantaa!

for developing the Business Intelligence environment and providing the organization with financial insights into the business in a proactive manner.

You will develop the BI landscape, e.g. Power BI & SAP analysis to support business in Finland in order to make data easily available for decision-making, forecasting, and the budget process. There is a strong focus and support in the Orkla group on BI development.

Additionally, your focus will be on monitoring and presenting customer profitability, analyzing campaigns, and supporting with forecasting, on a regular basis and ad hoc. You deepen financial understanding with employees and play an active role in delivering reports and challenging colleagues in the sales department. You support sales to achieve their financial targets and help them in the budget and planning process. You will report to the Finance Manager in Finland.

You are curious and determined, easy to approach, with commitment, engagement and the will to bravely create and contribute to a successful business. You are a team player and react with speed to changing circumstances and working conditions according to business needs.



Essential to your success is relevant experience in BI systems and controlling. If you have worked in an FMCG business, SAP, or D365 FO environment, it will be an asset to you. We expect you to have a relevant education and to be fluent in both written and spoken Finnish and English. Knowledge of Swedish is an advantage. You have a good ability to structure and analyze complex information and make it understandable for employees on all levels. Additionally, you have excellent Excel skills.

As a person, you are structured, analytical, and innovative with a strong drive to develop and the ability to execute.



At Orkla , you are constantly learning ‚Äì from different brands, experiences, people, markets, parts of the value chain, training, and ways of thinking. We are focused on providing new ways for people to develop different skills and how to use them to enhance the difference you can make ‚Äì to Orkla brands, to the business, and to the world.

We are committed to providing our employees with a dynamic environment surrounded by credible and trusted brands and countless opportunities to learn and grow. There are many companies to believe Orkla is the right place for you to work, here are some of the reasons why Orkla offers a unique and energizing workplace that encourages both commercial curiosity and freedom to fly.

The ability to work with strong local brands combined with the backdrop of a growing international company, gives our employees the opportunity to really make a difference and see the impact of their work.

We are part of Orkla Health portfolio company, and you can find more information about Health at https://www.orklahealth.com/

Locally, we operate under the name Orkla Care Finland which is formed by two companies: Orkla Care Oy and Pierre Robert Oy. Find out more about our local businesses:

https://www.orkla.fi/tietoa-meista/orkla-care-finland/






For further information on this exciting role, reach out to Mika H√§kkinen, Finance Manager, by phone +358 40 722 4219 on Thursday 26th October at 14-15, Tuesday 31st of October at 15-16, or Thursday 9th of November at 15-16.

Job Description

Technology is an indispensable part of our daily lives. But how do you find the devices that will deliver the best performance for your professional and personal needs?

UL benchmarks help people measure, understand and manage computer hardware performance. We create the industry's most trusted and widely usedis used by hundreds of press publications and millions of gamers, overclockers, and system builders around the world.

We are looking for a. We create the industry's most trusted and widely used benchmarks for desktop computers, notebooks, tablets, smartphones, and VR systems. Our development culture values innovation and personal initiative. We are looking for a developer who is able to design, implement and maintain reliable cross-platform solutions using modern working methods and quick release cycles.

You will be working with a team of passionate and highly skilled engineers that take pride in developing high-quality software.



















UL is a global safety science organization with more than a century of expertise and innovation in the fields of product safety testing, inspection and verification services. UL partners with businesses, manufacturers, trade associations, regulatory authorities, and governments to play a key role in the development and harmonization of national and international standards.

We create 3DMark, PCMark and VRMark, the world‚Äôs most popular benchmarks. We work with leading technology companies to develop benchmark tests for PCs, notebooks, tablets, smartphones, and VR systems. Our software is used throughout industry, by hundreds of press publications, and by millions of people around the globe. Find out more at https://benchmarks.ul.com/.

Working at UL is an exciting journey that twists and turns daily. We thrive in the twists and revel in the turns. This is our every day. This is our normal. Curious? To learn more about us and the work we do, visit UL.com

About the job
Job Description

Wolt is looking to expand its Security team, and we're hiring a Staff Security Engineer to help us build an even more secure Wolt. üìçThis role will be based in Helsinki or Stockholm, or you can work remotely anywhere in Finland or Sweden.

















The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you‚Äôll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Anna Pivovar (anna.pivovar@wolt.com).



Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions ‚Äì as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt‚Äôs products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt‚Äôs mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.



At Wolt, we‚Äôre about getting things done. You‚Äôll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we‚Äôre the very core of Wolt‚Äôs products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.



We want to have all sorts of people in our team ‚Äì people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates ‚Äì when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait ‚Äì we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together.

About the job
About Agoda 

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.



Location: Bangkok, Thailand (*Not open for remote work.)



Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.



As part of the Supply Analytics, you will be responsible for identifying new partners and opportunities, cultivating a relationship with them, and working together with them to deliver the best outcome for our end customers. You would also be responsible with managing the day-to-day interaction with the partner and working closely with other teams within Agoda to ensure the partners needs are met.

We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda‚Äôs unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we build new channels to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.



As an Analyst/Senior Analyst, you will report directly to either the Senior Manager or Associate Director within the Supply Department and this will be an individual contributor role. You will be responsible and fully empowered to work with the partners on the ground. You will be supported by a team within the Supply department and work closely with other Team members within Agoda.

job_description:
About the job
Job Title:

General Counsel

Job Description:

Join our team at Dentsu as an ambitious and experienced legal professional, ready to embrace new challenges and contribute to shaping our success here in Finland and the Baltics. This role is tailor-made for individuals with a keen commercial outlook and comfortable providing professional and strategic support to our Finnish and the Baltics leadership and organization. Be a part of our journey to excellence!


The General Counsel for Finland and the Baltics oversees legal matters at an executive level in Dentsu Finland and Dentsu Baltics. We are looking for a commercial legal executive with experience in fast-paced, customer-focused settings. You should possess experience in industries such as Technology, Media, and Telecommunications (TMT), consumer markets, or other dynamically changing fields. International exposure and a broad legal skill set encompassing commercial law, contract management, IP, IT, data protection, and compliance are crucial. While optional, DPO capabilities are beneficial, and HR-law knowledge is a plus.

The ideal candidate is proactive, hands-on, and solution-oriented. They build strong relationships with local leadership, brands, and networks. People leadership skills are vital, and adaptability in an innovative, fast-paced environment is key. A business mindset aligning with company needs is essential. Reporting primarily to the EMEA Deputy General Counsel and secondarily to the CEO in Finland, the position is based in Helsinki.

The role is currently envisaged to be part-time (3 days/week).






Dentsu Group is a global marketing communications company headquartered in Tokyo, Japan. It is one of the largest advertising and media firms in the world. The company offers a wide range of services in advertising, marketing, communication, and digital media, catering to clients across various industries.

We help clients to win, keep, and grow their best customers and achieve meaningful progress for their businesses with the best-in-class services and solutions in media, CXM, and creative. For more information please see: www.dentsu.com.

The dentsu L&C team comprises approximately 250 lawyers and compliance and data protection professionals across the world.


Joining dentsu, you‚Äôll join a team of 48,000 people. It‚Äôs‚ÄØan‚ÄØopportunity to produce career-defining work. Along the way, you‚Äôll team up with inspiring colleagues and encounter a richness of clients, cultures, and experiences.‚ÄØ We offer exciting challenges, a great working environment, memorable experiences, and opportunities to shape your future.


We offer a part-time permanent position with a 6-month probationary period, and you will be based at our office in Helsinki, Finland. We look forward to receiving your application.

For any questions, please contact:

Linda Ye, Talent Acquisition Partner

Linda.ye@dentsu.com


Helsinki


Dentsu


Part time


Permanent
